name: Grey Dogwood
climate: Grey Dogwood thrives in temperate climates with cool winters and warm summers.
It is adaptable to a wide range of climatic conditions but prefers a colder region.
The plant can tolerate pollution, which makes it ideal for urban environments.
It does well in climates that offer distinct seasonal changes year-round.
sunlight: Grey Dogwood grows best in full sunlight but can tolerate partial shade.
It benefits from at least 6 hours of direct sunlight per day for optimal growth.
Too much shade can reduce flowering and affect the health of the plant overall.
Providing a balance of sunlight and partial shade can promote vibrant foliage.
watering: Grey Dogwood requires regular watering during the first growing season.
It's important to keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
During dry seasons, increase watering to ensure the roots remain hydrated.
Once established, it becomes more drought-tolerant, needing less frequent watering.
soil: It grows best in moist, well-drained soil with a good amount of organic matter.
The plant is adaptable to a wide range of soil types, including clay or sandy soils.
Acidic to neutral soil pH is preferred but it can tolerate slight alkalinity.
Improving the soil with mulch or compost can help in retaining optimal moisture levels.
